Morgan St, MC 152, Chicago, IL, 60607    Office Phone:  (312) 996-3476    Email:  xiaorui@uic.edu    Related Sites:    View full profile          About   I am an assistant professor in the Computer Science Department of University of Illinois at Chicago.  Prior to joining UIC, I was at UC Berkeley Simons Institute and Microsoft Research. I recieved my Ph.D. in 2016 from Columbia University, where I was fortunate to be advised by Xi Chen.  My research is in theoretical computer science. More specifically, I work in parallel algorithms, sublinear algorithms and graph algorithms.  Research Interests:  Design and analysis of algorithms with an emphasis on big data processing, including algorithmic graph theory, massively parallel computing and machine learning theory
